question.title: Spring Boot 3.4.x + springdoc-openapi: NoSuchMethodError in ControllerAdviceBean during Swagger UI load
question.body:
I'm currently facing an issue while integrating Swagger UI with Spring Boot security in my project. Everything builds fine, but when I try to load Swagger UI (at /swagger-ui.html or /api-docs), I keep getting this runtime error:

java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: 'void org.springframework.web.method.ControllerAdviceBean.<init>(java.lang.Object)'

It seems to be triggered from inside springdoc classes like GenericResponseService when Swagger tries to render the OpenAPI docs.

My setup:

Spring Boot version: 3.4.5

Spring Framework version: 6.2.6

springdoc-openapi-starter-webmvc-ui version: 2.3.0 (also tried 2.5.0 — same error)

I've already tried:

Downgrading/Upgrading springdoc-openapi versions (tried 2.3.0 and 2.5.0)

Cleaning and rebuilding the Maven project

Checked that all dependencies align with Spring Boot 3.x and Spring 6.x

Despite this, the same NoSuchMethodError persists whenever Swagger UI or

/api-docs

endpoint is accessed.

From my research:

This looks like a compatibility issue because Spring Framework 6.2.x changed some internal method signatures (ControllerAdviceBean constructor), and springdoc-openapi 2.3.0/2.5.0 still expects the older signatures from Spring 6.1.x.

It appears stable Swagger + Spring Boot support is only guaranteed up to Spring Boot 3.2.x (Spring Framework 6.1.x).

Questions:

Is there an officially compatible version of springdoc-openapi that supports Spring Boot 3.4.x and Spring Framework 6.2.x?

Would downgrading to Spring Boot 3.2.4 be the most stable option for now to get Swagger UI working again?

Any workaround to suppress this specific Swagger error while keeping current Spring versions?

Would appreciate guidance from anyone who faced the same NoSuchMethodError with Spring Boot 3.4.x + springdoc-openapi setup. Thanks in advance!

answers.body:
As of now (May 2025), there is no official release of springdoc-openapi that is fully compatible with Spring Framework 6.2.x / Spring Boot 3.4.x. The latest stable versions (like 2.3.0 or 2.5.0) were built against Spring Boot 3.2.x and Spring Framework 6.1.x.

The maintainers of springdoc-openapi have not yet released an update compatible with Spring 6.2. The method signature change in ControllerAdviceBean is breaking for springdoc-openapi.

Would downgrading to Spring Boot 3.2.4 be the most stable option for now to get Swagger UI working again?

Yes. This is currently the most stable and widely used workaround.

You can downgrade to:

<spring-boot.version>3.2.4</spring-boot.version> <springdoc-openapi.version>2.3.0</springdoc-openapi.version> <!-- or 2.5.0 -->

This combination is known to work well together and avoids the breaking changes introduced in Spring 6.2.

Any workaround to suppress this specific Swagger error while keeping current Spring versions?

Unfortunately, there's no safe or supported workaround that will let you use springdoc-openapi with Spring 6.2.x at runtime because:

  • The exception occurs deep inside Spring internals (ControllerAdviceBean), so reflection tricks or bean exclusions are unreliable.

  • Even if you managed to hack around it, you'd likely hit other issues since Springdoc was not designed for Spring 6.2.x.

Use springdoc-openapi-starter-webmvc-ui 2.7.0 or higher

The issue seems to be due to mixing incompatible jars. I did face issue when upgrading springdoc-openapi-starter-webmvc-ui to 2.7.0. Bringing other spring libraries to compatible versions did resolve this.

I was able to get swagger-ui running with 3.4.1 for spring-boot-starter and spring-boot-starter-webflux, and 6.4.1/6.4.x  for springframework, spring security and few other spring libraries.

If you are overriding any transitive dependencies of spring-boot with a specific version, try removing that if possible and let spring-boot-starter bring the compatible dependencies.

Note: Reference doc

79656379.body: Thanks! Boot 3.5.5 works with 2.7.0, 2.8.0. Fails with [2.8.1-2.8.12]
